contents.content: UNIT 04 面试技巧 Interview Skills
Lesson 4 与面试官过招 Dealing with the Interviewer
杰克和玛丽在讨论如何恰当地应对面试官。

contents.title: 杰克：面试中如果遇到刁难性的问题，求职者往往会不知所措。
contents.answer: Jack: Confronted with diffi cult questions in an interview, the job-hunters mostly will be at a loss about what to do.

contents.title: 玛丽：这样的问题事先通常无法准备，只能临场发挥。
contents.answer: Mary: Usually, you cannot prepare for these questions in advance and have to depend on your immediate performance.

contents.title: 杰克：不过，还是有些方法可循。
contents.answer: Jack: Still, there are some rules to follow.

contents.title: 玛丽：在这样的情形下，首先要保持冷静，以平常心面对。
contents.answer: Mary: In this case, you should first keep calm and normal to the face.

contents.content: 职场达人小技巧  面试中的注意事项  一般来说，面对面试官不免会感到紧张慌乱，以至于在面试中云里雾里，不知所云。如果面试官再问些刁难性的问题，就更糟糕了。其实，面试官并没有那么可怕，不妨以平常心来应对。

contents.title: 杰克：一定不要怯场，以免自乱阵脚。
contents.answer: Jack: Don't get nervous and freaked out.

contents.title: 玛丽：要根据自己的情形做出较为满意的回答。
contents.answer: Mary: Formulate a satisfactory answer based on your specifi c situation.

contents.title: 杰克：既不能长时间沉默，也不可草率回答。
contents.answer: Jack: There should be neither too much silence nor hasty answers.

contents.title: 玛丽：言辞举止要大方得体，尽量展现自己最好的一面。
contents.answer: Mary: Try to show the best of yourself with decent words and manners.

contents.content: 回答封闭性的提问时，应当简明扼要，直切主题。  回答开放性的提问时，可以根据自己的实际情况作出较为满意的回答。  回答假设性的提问时，因为是要考察你解决或处理突发状况的能力，既不可长时间沉默，也不能轻率回答。最好是出奇制胜。

contents.title: 杰克：即便遇到否定性的提问，也不要沮丧气馁。
contents.answer: Jack: Don't be discouraged even when confronted with negative questions.

contents.title: 玛丽：应当坦然承认不足。
contents.answer: Mary: You should admit your weakness frankly.

contents.title: 杰克：不论如何，尽力而为，才是最重要的。
contents.answer: Jack: Anyway, what really matters is that you have tried your best.

contents.title: 玛丽：一定要相信自己。
contents.answer: Mary: You must have confi dence in yourself.

contents.content: 回答否定性的提问时，因为是要考察你的心理承受能力，务必保持风度，冷静沉着。坦然承认自己的不足，并努力展现自己的优势。  回答连续的提问时，虽然不是每一个问题都要详细回答，但最好按顺序展开。  总之，不同的问题有不同的回答方式。但所有的回答都是为了使求职者展现自己最好的一面。相信自己，你就是最好的。

contents.title: 面试时他总是不由自主地感到紧张。
contents.answer: He could not help always being nervous in the interview.

contents.title: 被问到刁难性的问题，她真的是不知所措。
contents.answer: She was just at a loss about what to do when asked the diffi cult questions.

contents.title: 回答问题时不要有过长时间的沉默。
contents.answer: Too much silence should be avoided before you give the answer.

contents.title: 轻率的回答可能预示着缺乏深思熟虑。
contents.answer: A hasty answer may reveal the lack of careful consideration.

contents.title: 保持冷静，才能做出满意的回答。
contents.answer: You should keep calm in order to give a satisfactory answer.

contents.title: 即使遇到刁难的提问，也要保持好的风度。
contents.answer: You should keep a good demeanor even when confronted with negative questions.

contents.title: 如果已经尽力，就可以无憾了。
contents.answer: If you have already tried your best, you should have no regret.

contents.title: 不论你如何回答，都要以自己的实际情况为准。
contents.answer: Whatever answer you give, you should base it on your own situation.

contents.title: 面对刁难，一味沮丧是不足取的。
contents.answer: It is undesirable to be just dismayed facingdiffi cult questions.

contents.title: 今天面试中的刁难问题让求职者失去了信心。
contents.answer: The diffi cult questions in the interview today were discouraging for the job-hunters.

contents.content: be at a loss about what to do 不知所措
try one's best 努力，尽力
